messages: 45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (23:57): I'm getting into the AIX world now
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (23:57): Orac?
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (23:57): cool
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (23:57): how ya doin man
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (23:58): good, still working on the aix
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (23:58): I just got started on it
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (23:58): taking some getting use to some of the tweaks from HP-UX
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (23:59): thats what  I needed
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (23:59): trying to get patches and such
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:00): btw.. you ever seen anyone get a fibre attached tape drive to boot?
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:02): or know how to use a mksysb image to create a dvd image that can be burned on a non aix machine
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:03): just used tapes, and nim myself
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:03): scsi attached tapes right?
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:03): how hard is nim to set up?
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:03): and can you mksysb TO it or just pull images down from a NIM server?
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:03): not that bad with smitty
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:03): both
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:04): hmm... maybe I should set up a linux box just to handle NIM then
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:04): since I have no more aix boxes
45b6db71b233fa960b64f245180b4575 (00:04): so SMS can boot and communicate with NIM eh?
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:05): not sure
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:06): have not done that part
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:08): just curious - anyone still running AIX on a Motorola Powerstack?
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:08): CyberS good luck :)_
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:08): I think 3.2.5 might run on it :P
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:09): could put net/open on it
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:09): Ober:  heh, yes - but only special install CDs AFAIR..
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:09): netboot it
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:10): Ober: well, I don't have AIX for PowerStack. Not easy to get.
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:11): I got another Model170 cheap, but that does not run stable :( .  So only access AIX at work...
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:15): Ober:  but speed with a 604e-200MHz wouldn't be so much fun anyway ;)
e45ab62daee7418dcc2c0c8b3fa3ef85 (00:19): sorry guys
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:20): CyberS: actually fast enough for net/open :P
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:22): Ober:  sounds interesting - do you have an url please?
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:22): www.netbsd.org
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:22): specifically the ofppc
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:23): Ober:  ah, you meant netbsd or openbsd - ok :)
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:23): sorry
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:23): what model powerstac was it?
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:23): Ober:  PowerStackII-604 with OF
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:23): http://www.netbsd.org/Ports/prep/
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:24): lot of work being done on that platform for support of more machines
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:25): I had NetBSD running on 68060 some years ago :)
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:26): Felt really fast with only 50 MHz.
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:26): but ATM i
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:27): i'd need a box with aix 5.3 to work with at home...
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:32): they made a 68060?
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:33): Ober:  yes, about 2-3x faster compared to the 68040-40MHz
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:34): really? need to get one then :P
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (00:34): running with 25mhz on a next slab
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:35): 060 was sold in some cpu-cards for C= Amigas: http://www.netbsd.org/Ports/amiga/
37367ede1b5c1da9962032f28f3cdbf5 (00:40): http://www.amiga-hardware.com/download_photos/csmkii060_2_big.jpg ;-)
